thread.title: Speedster Terrance Gore remains in ALCS roster
thread.title_full: Speedster Terrance Gore remains in ALCS roster

author: DeAnn Smith
title: Speedster Terrance Gore remains in ALCS roster
text:
Speedster Terrance Gore remains in ALCS roster Posted: Houston Astros' Luis Valbuena (18) fields a throw as Kansas City Royals' Terrance Gore (0) steals third base in the seventh inning during Game 4 against Houston. Gore was called out after an official review (AP) Speedster Terrance Gore remains in ALCS roster More>> Updated: Friday, October 16 2015 3:40 PM EDT 2015-10-16 19:40:26 GMT Major League Baseball has announced the dates and times for all the games in the American League Championship Series. More > Major League Baseball has announced the dates and times for all the games in the American League Championship Series. More > Royals start Volquez, Blue Jays go with Estrada in ALCS The Royals are sending Blue Jays antagonist Edinson Volquez to the mound for Game 1 of their AL Championship Series while Toronto is countering with Marco Estrada. More > The Kansas City Royals and Toronto Blue Jays promise plenty of fireworks in their AL Championship Series, and not just because one team features power arms and the other power bats. More > KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - 
Party like it's the ALDS. 
The Kansas City Royals announced Friday that they aren't making any changes to their roster for the ALCS. 
That means speedster Terrance Gore can again change the game by coming into the late innings as a pinch runner. Jonny Gomes who the Royals traded for this summer will remain on the bench as an inspirational leader. 
Gore hadn't been caught stealing in the big leagues until Monday's game against the Astros, and that took a controversial official review. 
The Royals send out Edinson Volquez as their starting pitcher while the Blue Jays counter with Marco Estrada. 
The umpires are Tony Randazzo, Laz Diaz, John Hirschbeck, who is the crew chief, Hunter Wendelstedt, Dan Iassogna, Jeff Nelson and Jim Reynolds. 
Diaz was attacked by a fan when the Royals played the White Sox in Chicago in 2003. 
First pitch is scheduled for 7:07 p.m. at Kauffman Stadium. We want to send your tailgating photos. Email them to yourphotos@kctv5.com or post them on Twitter with the hashtag #CrownCrazy.
